instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A2179 820-01958 20V 0.37A seems to be turning on but no PPVCC_CPU lines - Cola spill
threads.message:
Hi guys,

I have this A2179, which had a cola spill, melted USBC connector and trackpad connector on the trackpad side.
Replaced USBc connector on the board and socket; R6960 was severely corroded, I replaced it and now can power it on. 20V 0.37A but not getting any capslock, USB activity, or screen.

CPU is heating up, actually the whole board is reaching 34*C on a 20* day here. Also there is slight ticking noise from the board, but cant pinpoint the location.

Tried with both disconnected trackpad only and cable from the board to KBD/Tpad.

Which voltages should I report?
Coil voltage seems ok apart than these, which seem missing (or inaccurate?):

PPVCC_CPU_PH1 - 0V
PPVCC_CPU_PH2 - 0V
PPVCC_CPU_PH3 - 0V
VCCINAUX_SW - 1.81V

threads.title: A2179 820-01958 20V 0.37A seems to be turning on but no PPVCC_CPU lines - Cola spill
threads.message:
Possibly T2, or CPU damage.
Check if is detected in DFU mode.

threads.title: A2179 820-01958 20V 0.37A seems to be turning on but no PPVCC_CPU lines - Cola spill
threads.message: No picking up anything in DFU mode, so dead CPU/T2 it is, I guess.
